item.title: 新型人工智能工具对印度顶级IT企业施压
item.description: 最新进展可能阻碍印度IT股的复苏。【原文：The latest development could stall the recovery in Indian IT stocks.】

item.title: 中国高层官员誓言通过提振消费来重整经济
item.description: 中国将推进统一市场建设以释放国内消费潜力，一位高级经济官员表示，亚洲各国正面临全球经济转型中的"关键节点"。【原文：China will press ahead with building a unified market to unleash domestic consumption as countries around Asia face a “pivotal juncture” in the transformation of the global economy, a top economic official said.】

item.title: 印尼债券需求跌至一年低点，因MSCI风波
item.description: 印尼政府债券需求跌至逾一年低点，此前指数供应商MSCI公司对该国投资价值的担忧引发股市暴跌。【原文：Demand for Indonesian government bonds fell to the lowest in more than a year after an equity meltdown spurred by index provider MSCI Inc.’s concerns about the country’s investability.】

item.title: 中国将出台新电网备用政策以促进电池产业发展
item.description: 中国政府将通过扩大对储能补贴的力度，助力支撑全国范围内大规模电池的蓬勃发展。【原文：The Chinese government will help underpin the nationwide boom in large-scale batteries by expanding its subsidies for energy storage.】

item.title: 中国服务业活动增速加快，尽管需求疲软
item.description: 一项私人调查显示，中国服务业活动在连续四个月增速放缓后有所回升，这表明尽管今年开局艰难，但经济某些领域正重现增长动能。【原文：China’s services activity picked up after growing at a slower rate for four straight months, a private survey showed, suggesting that pockets of the economy are seeing renewed momentum despite a rocky start to the year.】

item.title: 富士媒体股价下跌，回购计划预示激进投资者退出
item.description: 富士媒体控股公司股价暴跌逾12%，此前这家深陷困境的日本企业宣布大规模回购计划，并称激进投资者村上义昭关联实体已表示将出售所持股份。【原文：Fuji Media Holdings Inc. shares plunged as much as 12% after the embattled Japanese firm announced a large share buyback plan and said entities linked to activist investor Yoshiaki Murakami indicated they would sell their stakes.】

item.title: 越南放宽外资准入规则 为市场升级铺路
item.description: 越南将允许外国投资者通过全球经纪商直接进行交易，而非通过本土公司。此举旨在提升市场准入度，该国正为从富时罗素指数的新兴市场升级做准备。【原文：Vietnam will allow foreign investors to trade through global brokerages directly instead of with local firms, a step aimed at improving market accessibility as the country prepares for an upgrade to emerging-market status from FTSE Russell.】

item.title: 香港亿万富豪家族办公室注资1亿美元人工智能基金
item.description: 由前商汤科技董事总经理黄婕创立的3C AGI Partners，正推出一支由家族办公室支持的人工智能风险基金。该家族办公室为香港部分最富有的家族管理资金。【原文：3C AGI Partners, founded by former SenseTime Group Inc. managing director Esther Wong, is launching an artificial intelligence venture fund backed by a family office that runs money for some of Hong Kong’s richest families.】

item.title: 分析师称印度央行或转向购汇以增加储备
item.description: 部分分析师指出，卢比七年来最大涨幅将为央行重建外汇储备创造空间，这可能限制在印美贸易协议提振后汇率的进一步上涨。【原文：The rupee’s biggest rally in seven years will give the central bank scope to rebuild its foreign-exchange reserves, potentially limiting further gains after the boost from the India-US trade deal, according to some analysts.】

item.title: 新加坡政府投资公司与淡马锡调整对冲基金合作模式
item.description: 新加坡两大国有投资机构正大幅调整与对冲基金的合作模式，此举可能影响数十亿美元的资金配置。【原文：Singapore’s two largest state-owned investors are making major changes to the way they work with hedge funds, in moves that could affect billions of dollars in allocations.】

item.title: 交易员加码押注澳大利亚将开启全球首个加息周期
item.description: 随着经济学家和市场加大对再次加息的押注，澳大利亚有望成为2026年全球首个启动紧缩周期的国家，这标志着该国央行在遏制通胀复苏方面面临巨大挑战，政策方向出现急转直下。【原文：Australia is on track for the world’s first tightening cycle of 2026 as economists and markets ramp up bets on another interest-rate increase, marking a sharp reversal for a central bank struggling to contain resurgent inflation.】

item.title: 对冲基金在日本大选前重启日元看跌交易
item.description: 对冲基金正重启做空日元的押注，押注日元将再度走弱，因日本本周末将迎来关键大选。【原文：Hedge funds are reviving bets against the yen, positioning for renewed weakness as Japan heads into a pivotal election this weekend.】

item.title: 人工智能颠覆担忧拖累亚洲软件制造商股价
item.description: 亚洲软件股下跌，因人工智能应用日益普及，市场担忧其业务将受到冲击。【原文：Asian software stocks dropped as fears grow over disruption of their businesses as the use of artificial intelligence gains traction.】

item.title: 股市波动率飙升预示日本大选前市场动荡
item.description: 日本投资者在选举前夕的紧张程度前所未有。【原文：Investors in Japan have rarely been this nervous before an election.】

item.title: Anthropic Plans Employee Tender Offer at $350 Billion Valuation
item.description: Anthropic is working on a deal to let some employees sell shares in the company at a valuation of at least $350 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter, a plan that is coming together at the same time as a funding round that could bring in more than $20 billion.

item.title: 印度央行遏制收益率的战役因莫迪政府财政支出激增而愈发艰难
item.description: 即便印度储备银行已累计降息逾1个百分点，并向经济体系注入创纪录的流动性，投资者仍拒绝压低债券收益率。随着印度央行本周即将公布新一轮政策决定，市场正密切关注行长桑杰·马尔霍特拉将如何应对这一挑战。【原文：Even after the Reserve Bank of India cut rates more than 1 percentage point and pumped record amounts of cash into the economy, investors are refusing to push down bond yields. As the RBI readies another policy decision this week, they’re keen to see how Governor Sanjay Malhotra tackles the challenge.】

item.title: Nintendo Shares Plunge 10% After Weak Profit Spurs Margin Fears
item.description: Nintendo Co.’s shares slid their most since April after the company reported disappointing earnings, revealing a big hit to margins while concerns grow about the impact of soaring memory chip prices in 2026.

item.title: Global Investors Shun Thailand as Election Overhang Hits Assets
item.description: Thailand’s inability to revive its economy has left its stocks and bonds in an unenviable position: cheap, unloved and increasingly irrelevant.

item.title: UK Looks at Subsidizing Small Modular Reactors to Power AI Boom
item.description: The UK is laying out plans to help the development of small nuclear reactors as it seeks to power a boom in artificial intelligence.

item.title: Shipping Firms Face Tough 2026 as Reopening of Red Sea Looms
item.description: Global container liners are bracing for lower profits in 2026 as the potential reopening of the Red Sea shipping route weighs on freight rates, exacerbating oversupply issues and aggravating trade pains.

item.title: Oil Rises on Flare-Up in US-Iran Tensions and Inventory Decline
item.description: Oil rose for a second day as geopolitical tensions resurfaced following the US downing of an Iranian drone near an American aircraft carrier in the Arabian Sea.

item.title: Nvidia Nears Deal to Invest $20 Billion in OpenAI Round
item.description: Nvidia Corp. is nearing a deal to invest $20 billion in OpenAI as part of its latest funding round, according to people familiar with the matter, marking the chipmaker’s single biggest investment in the ChatGPT developer.

item.title: Gold Holds Gains After Historic Retreat Lures Back Dip Buyers
item.description: Gold steadied, after recovering some losses when dip buyers stepped in following an abrupt retreat from record highs.

item.title: OpenAI Fills Safety Job Listed at $555,000 With Anthropic Hire
item.description: In December, OpenAI made headlines when it posted a job listing for a “head of preparedness” with an eye-watering base pay range of as much as $555,000 a year. On Tuesday, Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman announced that the job has now been filled — by a staffer at rival AI model developer Anthropic.

item.title: Asian Stocks Poised to Track US Tech-Led Selloff: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks in Asia are set to follow Wall Street lower, after a tech selloff dragged down benchmarks and saw a rotation into more economically sensitive industries.

item.title: Pipeline Explodes at Delfin LNG Planned Project in Louisiana
item.description: A natural gas pipeline connecting to the proposed Delfin LNG project located offshore in southwestern Louisiana exploded Tuesday, according to the local emergency preparedness office.

item.title: Super Micro Boosts Sales Outlook, Easing Data Center Delay Fears
item.description: Super Micro Computer Inc. gave a strong forecast for sales in the current quarter, easing concerns the server maker is failing to benefit from demand for gear to run AI data centers. The shares gained in late trading.

item.title: Musk Loses Attempt to Dismiss SEC Twitter Stake Lawsuit
item.description: A federal judge rejected Elon Musk’s attempt to throw out a US Securities and Exchange Commission lawsuit alleging he waited too long to disclose his growing stake in Twitter.

item.title: Musk’s xAI Merger Poses Bigger Threat to OpenAI, Anthropic
item.description: For much of the past three years, Elon Musk’s xAI has tried to compete against the leading AI labs, including OpenAI, the company he co-founded and later clashed with. The results have been mixed: xAI’s flagship product, the chatbot Grok, has made headlines for antisemetic responses and sexualized images that have overshadowed its technological advances.

item.title: Sonos Plans ‘Several’ New Products This Year After App Debacle
item.description: Sonos Inc. plans to release “several” products this year, the clearest indicator yet that the audio company is ready to move past a lengthy period of software-related turmoil and resume consumer hardware launches.
